alert.note: Alert for Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 30 at 3:20PM EST until January 31 at 11:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to two inches, mainly north of Ontonagon and Mass City. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero, mainly for interior areas away from the lakeshores. * WHERE...Ontonagon County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 9 PM this evening to 11 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Warmer conditions immediately near Lake Superior will limit wind chill values. However, wind chills as low as 25 below zero will be possible.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
